text:
The attached DocBook XML document contains two tables (because DocBook supports two table styles): a normal HTML table, see:
http://www.docbook.org/tdg5/en/html/html.td.html
and a CALS table, see:
http://www.docbook.org/tdg5/en/html/cals.table.html

Both contain a row which spans 2 columns. This works correctly for the second (CALS) table, but not for the HTML table.

Tried tith the latest stable DocBook-stylesheets 1.74.0 (-ns Variant from July 2008) with FOP 0.95 under Windows (and also under Linux).
creator: rosenauer@gmx.at

text:
Hi,

There's no attachment actually...

Moreover, I somehow doubt that FOP is at fault here. It may be a problem with the DocBook XSLT style sheets, or even simply a matter of a style sheet customisation. You may want to describe your problem on the docbook-apps [1] mailing list first.

[1] http://wiki.docbook.org/topic/DocBookAppsMailingList

Thanks,
Vincent
creator: vhennebert@gmail.com
gadams@apache.org
text: resolved invalid due to lack of information (FO input file, PDF output file, etc)
